text: William J. Hodgson Jr. (born c. 1944) was a Canadian curler. He was the second of the 1975 Brier Champion team (skipped by Bill Tetley), representing Northern Ontario. The team later went on to finish third at the World Championships of that year.http://www.nwosportshalloffame.com/inductees/inductee_team.aspx?id=30 He was Vice President, Commercial Services, Cambrian Credit Union.Sleepless night helps Northern Ontario team to Brier title PAUL PATTON Globe and Mail Reporter The Globe and Mail (1936-Current); Mar 10, 1975; ProQuest Historical Newspapers: The Globe and Mail pg.
